abstract: An internal report written by a management task force pointed to widespread failures regarding a bad bet on credit derivatives that cost JPMorgan Chase more than $6 billion.
snippet: An internal report written by a management task force pointed to widespread failures regarding a bad bet on credit derivatives that cost JPMorgan Chase more than $6 billion.
lead_paragraph: Long seen as one of the most careful banks on Wall Street, JPMorgan Chase on Wednesday drew back a curtain on a rare breakdown, showing traders acting on their own and concealing losses while managers seemingly turned a blind eye.

headline.main: Report Details Missteps in Trading at JPMorgan
headline.print_headline: Report Details Missteps In Trading at JPMorgan

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Peter Eavis

abstract: The action was said to be a message that the board of JPMorgan Chase was a strong watchdog over the nation’s largest bank.
snippet: The action was said to be a message that the board of JPMorgan Chase was a strong watchdog over the nation’s largest bank.
lead_paragraph: Shortly after the markets closed on Tuesday afternoon, an emissary from JPMorgan Chase’s board of directors walked two flights down to the 48th-floor corner office of the bank’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, to deliver a stark message. The board had voted to slash Mr. Dimon’s annual compensation for 2012 by half.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Board Uses a Pay Cut as a Message
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Uses Big Cut in Pay To Send Signal

abstract: SurveyMonkey, which provides online surveys, closed on a new round of financing that values the company at about $1.35 billion.
snippet: SurveyMonkey, which provides online surveys, closed on a new round of financing that values the company at about $1.35 billion.
lead_paragraph: SurveyMonkey’s fund-raising success is showing that the business of Internet surveys is worth a lot of money.

headline.main: SurveyMonkey Raises Nearly $800 Million While Staying Private

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The internal report released by JPMorgan Chase this week related to a disastrous bet on a hedging strategy may not be a good guidebook for federal prosecutors looking to build a criminal case, the author writes.
snippet: The internal report released by JPMorgan Chase this week related to a disastrous bet on a hedging strategy may not be a good guidebook for federal prosecutors looking to build a criminal case, the author writes.
lead_paragraph: The internal report released by JPMorgan Chase this week related to a disastrous bet on a hedging strategy may not be a good guidebook for federal prosecutors.

headline.main: Few Possibilities for Prosecution at JPMorgan
